loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old and married, residing at Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Manuel is operating a gardening business venture to earn a living and has been 15 years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Manuel wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. Her husband, Juma, is a businessman who contributes to providing family basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past 2 years; in addition she sells vegetables. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her businesses.
 
With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children. 

To make a living, Liezl owns and operates a business venture manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for 6 years, she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Liezl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Uwani

texts.en:
Uwani is a 48-year-old married woman with 6 children, 2 of whom attend school. Her husband, Omari, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. Uwani owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Uwani has operated a vegetable grocery for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; in the dry seasons there are low harvests. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of cabbage, tomatoes, onions and carrots for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cabbage, tomatoes, onions and carrots for resale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old. Elsie is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a fishing business venture. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 2,300 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Elsie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2008, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Kombo, is a fisherman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Fatuma has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years; her potential clients are her neighbors and the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. Her husband Swalehe is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. 

Deborah has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past 6 years; her potential clients are residents of the local area. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing a water distribution business.

With the requested loan of KES 21,190, Deborah wants to pay her children's school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old, is married, and has two children. Mira owns and operates a business raising pigs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Mira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mira is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 47-year-old widowed woman with eight children, three of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Elizabeth has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 4 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the requested loan of KES 10,000, Elizabeth wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 49 years old and married with four school-aged children, the firstborn being 18. He lives with his family in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for nearly 17 years. His farm produces milk, maize, and beans for the local market.

David has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a a dairy cow. He says this will boost his dairy business and earn income he will use to educate his children. He adds that milk has always been, and will continue to be, his family's daily food supplement. He aspires to own a vehicle to make deliveries to the market as well as to offer transport services to other farmers in the area. He sees animal diseases as his major farming challenge.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 55-year-old widow with 3 children, all of whom are working. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Anastasia has operated a cereals business for the past 4 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of lacking a sufficient number of customers. She dreams of establishing a retail shop.

With the requested loan of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase more stocks of maize and cow peas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize and cow peas for resale.

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
A single woman in a village of the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia, Nen now is 40 years old. To make a living, she has been farming her plot of land as primary business for almost twenty eight years and she supplements her income by raising pigs in her backyard. With her current business, she manages to earn less than US$4 per day and is able to save less than US$2 each day. 

This is Nen’s group first loan with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund.  Now requesting a loan with another member, she will use the entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also buy feed for her pigs.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the farm and buy pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 years and 12 years. He produces vegetables, groundnuts, hot pepper, and sugarcane, which he sells to the local market. He has been in farming for four years and currently employs two farmhands. He also operates a taxi business.

Micah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the venture into dairy farming will provide the family with milk for their daily consumption as well as income for other family needs. He aspires to own a canter to transport other farmers' produce to the market for a fee. He says animal diseases remains a challenge to many farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coffee seedlings to replant.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a 57-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 22 and 23. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

To earn a living, Apolonia buys and sells scrap materials such as bottles and plastic containers. She has been in this business for 5 years. Apolonia works hard to improve her earnings and help provide for her family's needs. She has requested this loan to buy more scrap to sell.

In the future, Apolonia hopes that her family's living situation will improve.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Kaiki

texts.en:
Kaiki is 32 years old and married with three children. He has been a animal trader for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy more animals to sell.

With the profits generated he plans to pay his children's school fees. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy more animals to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with three children who are all grown up. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Salima has operated a rental house business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of delays in rent payment from her tenants. She dreams of owning more rental houses.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase ceiling boards and paint, and to pay some laborers to renovate her rental house. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase ceiling boards and paint, and to pay some laborers to renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children between the ages of 3 and 19. Bebiana's husband works as a farmer.

Bebiana sells food items in her community. She makes banana and camote (sweet potato) cues (fried snacks with caramelized brown sugar) to sell. She also sells friend peanuts. Bebiana has been in this business for two years. She earns 2,000 PHP per month. She plans to use her loan to buy more ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and bananas. Bebiana hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and bananas

loans.name: Yegon

texts.en:
Yegon is a resident and a farmer in Litein. His farm produces mainly milk, onions, and tea. He earns additional income by working occasionally in a local tea factory. He is married and has five children between the ages of 15 and 1.

Yegon has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and a chuff cutter to help in feeding his dairy animals. He says this will improve his milk production, as well as help him find a new venture into poultry farming.

He states the lack of funds as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry and a chuff cutter

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Sin lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She is a married mother of only son who is too young to attend school. Rice farming has been her main source of income to make a living for more than three years. Sometimes, she and her husband work for others for pay to earn more income. 

Sin’s group consists of two members and has been with VisionFund for two years. Since 2009, the loan has helped her make a living better. She currently earns more than US $5 per day and is able to save around US $2 each day. She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,200,000 each to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her lifestyle and send her son to school regularly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his family in Litein where he is a farmer. His farm produces milk, potatoes, and maize for the local market. His farm is run with the help of two farmhands.

Joseph has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says the increased dairy income will help him build a modern zero grazing unit, improve on the quality of his cows for better income, and meet family needs.

He states that limited financial resources, poor weather, and animal diseases remain the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance, aged 41, is a widow. She has four children aged between 12 and 22; all of them are enrolled in school. She sells meat and supplies different hotels (small restaurants) around her. She has spent four years doing the same business. 

She has requested the loan to upgrade her business in terms of an inventory increase. She will use the profits to reinvest in the same business. She would like to be a sole supplier of meat in the future.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has three children.

Sabah is a carpenter; he has owned since 2006 a workshop where he makes and sells furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to purchase woodworking machinery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase woodworking machinery.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is age 27 and has been in farming for 5 years, doing mainly tea and horticultural products.  He is married with one child age eight months.  He sells his produce to the local market.

Evans has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.  He says he wants to embark on intensive dairy farming so that he can meet the needs of his family.  He adds that the market for horticultural products is not consistent and requires better management with a ready market and transportation being the major limitations in the area.

He reiterates that the market is a real challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino is 42 years old and is a married man with 6 children.  His oldest child is 16 years old.

Catalino has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business for 5 years.  He earns about 3,000 PHP per month.  Catalino works hard to support his family.  One of his top priorities right now is his children's education.  Catalino is hoping to expand his business in the future.

Catalino will use his loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and pay for a tune-up.  He hopes for his income to increase so he can sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and pay for a tune-up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Scholastique

texts.en:
Scholastique is 51 years old.  She has four children who are all enrolled in school.  Scholastique sells charcoal and has spent 8 years in this business. 

She has requested the loan to buy more charcoal to sell.  She has decided to use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children and to make savings.  She dreams to become an international businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, peas and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kandi

texts.en:
Kandi is 35 years old.  She is married and has four school aged children.  To make a living, she does mixed farming.  She has been engaged in her farming for over eight years and earns approximately KES.5,000 a month for these activities. 

She has been a good client and this is her 4th loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies, including fertilizers and seeds. 
Kandi hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 29 years old.  She has one child who is two and a half years old.  Her husband works in the government as a tax collector. 

She has run a business of canteen for the last 3 years.  She has requested the loan to add more items for her canteen business. She says that the profits will be used for making savings and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more canteen items to sell.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with three children and all her children go to school.  She has one additional family member.  She sells soft drinks from home on a retail basis.  She is also a primary school teacher.  She has been in this business for the last 6 years.  She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more utensils to be used in selling her juice, a bag of passion fruits and crates of soda. Her major business challenge is the seasonality.  Her goal is to build rental houses and also own a room where she can sell her soft drinks from.  She lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and boxes of mineral water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock to her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to make more clothing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children and of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on retail basis. She also has rental rooms and piped water. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. 

Joyce has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major challenge is transportation. Her aspiration is to expand into the wholesale business .She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and monthly market dues.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang is a 29-year-old married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district. She grows rice and potatoes for her livelihood and she has been in the business for ages. She has been blessed with three children who are single and live together with her in their home. They always assist her to do the farming work when they have free time from school. 

Mrs. Neang would like to acquire some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for rented farmland. Through using this loan from our lenders, Mrs. Neang will be able to continue running her present business. In the future, she wishes to own a few plots of land herself.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland.

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
From Prey Chor District of Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Mrs. Doung is a 45-year-old married mother who lives with her five lovely kids. Two of them are married and live in a separate house. She is a lovely mother who works in the rice business. She is a responsible mother who pays a lot of attention to ensuring that she can provide for her children and give them a good education.

She earns enough each day to cover her family's expenses. Mrs. Doung has been involved in the rice business for a long time. In order to improve the standard of life of her family, she would like to purchase a cow, but she doesn't have enough capital. This is why she decided with her family to take a loan from HKL, a partner of Kiva. She says that this support and help will allow her family to live in comfort, happiness and prosperity. 

She commits that she will pay back the loan punctually to the kind lenders. She and her family are very grateful to all the donors that always help her family avoid poverty. This is her first loan cycle with HKL, and the first loan with a Kiva partner. She does not have another state bank aside from HKL, because she said that HKL is the one micro-finance institution that provides lower interest, good services and long-term loan periods.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty sells newspapers at the roadside on a retail basis. She generates additional income through a pay phone. Resty has been in her business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more newspapers so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenge is seasonality and price fluctuation. Her aspiration is to buy a plot of land and also to become a newspaper agent. 

Resty is divorced with one child who is in school. She has two additional family members (a sister and brother). She lives in Kampala, Uganda, in her own house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Martha has operated a food stall for the past year; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of customers not making their payments on time. She dreams of establishing a café.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, beans, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, beans, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her aspiration is to see her business grow big into wholesale and also to start going to the villages of Masaka for bunches of bananas.

Mary is single with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She  lives in Kampala, Uganda, in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to add to her stock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 50-year-old widowed woman with five children, all of whom are grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Beatrice has operated a poultry-selling business for the past six years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medication for her poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medication for her poultry business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: 57-year-old Divina is a married woman with six children. Her husband works as a carpenter. Divina is in the business of food vending. She makes rice cakes and banana cues to sell in her community. Divina earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos per month with her business. Divina is able to help provide for her family's needs with her income. She requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, bananas and cooking oil. Divina hopes this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, bananas and cooking oil

loans.name: Koitankei

texts.en:
Koitankei has been farming for the last ten years. He is 49 years old, married and supports eleven people in the family.

He has been a good client who was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He has now applied for his third loan, which he plans to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. 

In the future, he hopes to see his children live in prosperity.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mr. Mey is a resident of Takhmao town. He acts as a local nurse in his neighborhood, generating approximately $2.00 per day, while his wife works for a company in Phnom Penh city. Mey doesn’t have any children yet, even though now he’s 45 years old. He really wishes to have one someday. 

There are currently some broken parts of his house, which are in immediate need of repair in order for them to have a comfortable life. However, Mey doesn’t have enough funds to fix his house. So he decided to ask for some funds from HKL to partially fix his present house. In the future, Mey hopes to own a small pharmacy in his commune.

loans.use: to fix his present house partially.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, two of whom attend school.  She has no additional family members. 

Robinah has a retail shop at the market.  She also sells piped water.  She has been in business for the last seven years and works six days a week.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice and salt.  The two major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and price fluctuation.  Her goal is to expand into the wholesale business.  

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap and rice.

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.ru: Фозилджон трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Более 13 лет он занимается купле- продажей мелкого рогатого скота на местном скотном рынке. Он имеет большой опыт работы и знает все секреты данного бизнеса. На сегодняшний день он имеет 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Фозилджон хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия и запрашивает займ для ремонта своего дома.  Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Foziljon is a kind, hardworking man. He is married and has two children. For more than 13 years he has bought and sold small livestock at the local market. He has a lot of work experience and knows all the tricks of the trade. He currently has 10 heads of small livestock. Foziljon wants to improve his living conditions and is requesting a loan for home repairs. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Jethro

texts.en:
Jethro is 60 years old.  He has four children aged 30, 25, 22, and 18 years.  His spouse, Gladys, is a primary school teacher.  He is a poultry farmer in Kapsabet and has been in business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

He has borrowed a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD.  This is his third term loan after servicing the previous loan successfully.  He wishes to use this loan to purchase more chickens to rear on his farm.  He will use the anticipated profit to improve the living standards of his family.

He hopes to increase the number of chickens he rears and also to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Она замужем. Ей 27 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее муж занимается торговлей фруктов. Сама Махфират занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она три года. Кредит берет для закуп телят.
texts.en: Makhfirat lives in the Tursun-zoda.  She is 27 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is involved in selling fruits.  Makhfirat is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  She has been in this field for three years.  Makhfirat is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Gulkhan

texts.ru: Гульхан замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж работает пекарем. Чтобы помогать мужу в содержании семьи она начала заниматься откармливанием скота. Она содержит скот. Гульхан хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса и получения хорошей прибыли.
texts.en: Gulkhan is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works as a baker.  In order to help her husband support the family, she became involved in fattening up livestock.  She keeps livestock.  Gulkhan wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 Somoni to purchase cattle in order to expand her business and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Более 15 лет она занимается откармливанием скота. Имеет в обороте 4 голов крупного рогатого скота, из них двое дойная корова. Махфират старается расширить свой бизнес ради улучшения своих жилищных условий семьи. Махфират хотел бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки корма для скота.
texts.en: Makhfirat is married and a loving mother of three children. She has been in the business of fattening cattle for more than fifteen years. She has four heads of cattle in stock with two of them milk cows. Makhfirat tries to expand her business for the sake of improving living conditions for her family. Makhfirat would like to take out a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni to purchase livestock fodder.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare the maize porridge she sells.

loans.name: Sop Sa Aladji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe sop sa aladji a été créé le 08 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche. Binta debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et a la charge de 05 enfants. Elle est fait la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis 04 ans. Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des arachides. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des  enfants
texts.en:
Sop Sa Aladji Group was established on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 12 women coming from the same village. Their main businesses are retailing and raising livestock.

Binta is responsible for the group. She's the one standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's 37 years old, married, and has five children to support.

She transforms peanuts into oil. She has a good experience in this field, due to the fact that she's been running this business for four years. Her loan will enable her to buy peanuts.

Her ambition is to help her husband in taking care of the children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa, who is married to a farmer, extracts palm kennel oil for sale in Abrafo near Abura. In business for seven years now, she uses her income to support her husband to pay their accomodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more palm kernels for the extraction of oil to sell. With the new profit, Adjoa will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель города Истаравшан. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Хасан более шести лет занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для покупки детской осеней обуви и костюмчиков.
texts.en:
Hasan is a resident of the city Istaravshan. He is 41 years old and married. He has three children.

Hasan has been engaged in trade for more than 6 years. Currently he sells children's clothes. He takes a loan for the purchase of children's autumn shoes and children's costumes.

loans.use: to buy children's autumn shoes and children's costumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm kernels for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.name: And Jef Group

texts.fr: Le groupe And Jëf a été créé le 08 Mai 2010. IL est composé de 12 membres issues du même village, elles s'activent dans l'embouche et le petit commerce. Ndioba est la responsable du groupe. Elle debout à droite sur la photo. Elle est mariée et âgée de 29 ans. Elle fait de la couture(draps de lit, pagne)comme activité principale. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité. Son prêt va la permettre d'acheter du tissu des fils pour broderie. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne d’accroître  son activité.
texts.en:
The group And Jëf was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 12 members from the same village. They are active in animal fattening and shopkeeping. 

Ndioba is responsible for the group. She is standing on the right in the photo. She is married and 29 years old. Her main business is sewing (bed sheets, loin cloths). She has good experience for this type of business. 

Her loan will allow her to buy fabric and embroidery thread. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia extracts oil from palm kernels and sells it. She lives in Abrafo near Abura, and is divorced with three children. Efia has been doing this work for six years now. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase palm kernels from which she will extract oil to sell. With the profit that she makes, Efia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels so she can make oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm kernels so she can make oil to sell.

loans.name: Daradji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Daradji a été crée le 08 mai 2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent pratiquement les mêmes activités (embouche et petit commerce) Ndiagna Debout à droite de la photo est la  responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement  en légumes et acheter un mouton à emboucher. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Daradji was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 10 women from the same region. They are in practically the same businesses (animal fattening and shopkeeping).

Ndiagna, standing on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 45 years old. She is married and mother to six children. She fattens sheep.

With her loan she is going to increase her stock of vegetables and buy a sheep to fatten. Her profits will allow her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and vegetables.

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa is a petty trader; she sells cloth and shoes in Abrafo near Abura. She is single and has one child. Adowa has been a petty trader for 5 years. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying for her child. Her loan will be used to purchase cloth and shoes for sale. She hopes to put the new profits from her business into savings which will enable her to give her child the best education.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and shoes for sale

loans.name: Susuna

texts.en: Susuna is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents. She has been.extracting and selling  palm kernel oil for 8 years in Abrafo, near Abura. Susuna uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase palm kernels to extract oil for sale. With the new profit,  Susuna will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernels to extract oil for sale.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Madicke Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE MADIKE a été crée le 08 mai 2010. Il est composé de 15 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent pratiquement toutes les mêmes activités (la transformation d'huile, le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine) Ndoumbé debout à droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe, elle habillée en vert avec une écharpe blanche. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants et 02 autres qu'elle a en charge. Elle vend du pain et des pains de singe dans le village, elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Madike was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 15 women from the same locale. They are all in practically the same businesses (processing oil, shopkeeping and fattening sheep).

Ndoumbé, standing on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is dressed in green with a white scarf. She is 49 years old. She is married and mother to six children and takes care of two other children.

She sells bread and baobab fruit in the village and also fattens sheep. Her profits will allow her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bread and baobab fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of maize and fish to prepare banku for sale

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.ru: Абдукаххор женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Он начал свой бизнес 12 лет назад с выращивания винограда, а теперь добавил еще выращивание помидоров и огурцов. Имеет землю в своей деревне. Абдукаххор запрашивает займ для покупки семян огурцов и помидоров, селитру и аммофос. А на остальную сумму хочет купить пленку для парника. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abdukahhor is married and is raising three children.  He started his business 12 years ago with growing grapes and now also added growing tomatoes and cucumbers.  He has land in his village.  Abdukahhor is requesting this loan to purchase cucumber and tomato seeds, and mineral fertilizers.  And he wants to use the rest of the money to buy plastic for a greenhouse.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé le 08 mai 2010.IL est composé de 09 membres issues du même village. La responsable du groupe est Aïssatou, elle debout à droite sur la photo. Elle est habillé en blanc. Elle est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle fait de l'embouche. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années. Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des moutons à emboucher. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants et de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 9 members from the same village. The person responsible for the group is Aïssatou, standing on the right in the photo. She is dressed in white. She is 38 years old, married and mother to three dependent children.

She fattens sheep. She has been practicing this business for several years. 

Her loan will allow her to buy sheep to fatten. Her goal is to take care of her children and to contribute to her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Mary. She is single and has 2 children, aged 21 and 20, one of whom is in college. Mary has 2 additional dependents who live with her in order to attend school. In 1992, Mary established her essential drugs (pharmacy) business. When Mary left high school, she did not have someone to sponsor her because her parents were poor. She went into sales and when she had enough capital, she opened a small stall. In order to fulfill her dream of becoming a nurse, she enrolled in training as a pharmacist and she now owns a pharmacy, selling drugs to patients. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, Mary earns about SLL 2,256,000 monthly from her business.

Mary has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She would now like a new loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy Pinoplex blood syrup (4 cartons @ SLL 140,000 each), pain relief (5 cartons @ SLL 50,000 each), Lucmal (anti malarial) drug (10 cartons @ SLL 120,000 each), Zincofer blood syrup (5 cartons @ SLL 140,000 each), Lucozade (10 cartons @ SLL 100,000 each) and Amodiquin hydrochlode tabs (1 carton @ SLL 250,000), with the balance used as transport fare. Mary hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 564,000.

Mary doesn't face much competition since she is the only one owning a pharmacy in the area. She serves about 60 people per day, and her business is popular because she treats her customers with care and respect. Mary is assisted by her closest family members. She usually orders twice a month through delivery van from Freetown. In the future, Mary plans to save enough money for her retirement. She feels good and nervous about the future prospects of her business because she needs someone with good experience and capabilities to run her business when she retires. She wants her child and her dependents to finish school. The loan will help as she will be able to save money. Mary is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of assorted medications

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, bananas, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabrics and embroideries for her business.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of family basic needs.

Luvuno has operated a retail shop for the past 4 years. In addition to the shop, she runs a water selling business and owns a (boda boda) motorcycle  transport business. Her potential clients are her neighbors. Luvunno's major challenge is competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, soap, cooking oil and sugar for resale in her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, soap, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 39-year-old married woman with 6 children all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband Wanini is an electrician who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mercy has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past 4 years; her potential clients are local area residents. She faces a major challenge of competition from other motorbike transport operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorbike and buy fuel. She decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle and buy fuel .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Chinyavi

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school, while the other is still too young for school. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Chinyavu has operated a vegetable grocery for the past three years; her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his siblings. 

Michael has operated a retail shop for the past four years; his potential clients are his neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more stocks of sugar, maize and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, maize and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a car washing machine (a pressure water pump) for his business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a single man who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his siblings. 

Alex has been operating as a vegetable farmer for the past 4 years. He sells vegetables and potatoes from his farm to vegetable grocery owners and to neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. Alex dreams of owning a big farm in the future.

Alex plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase a water pump and pipes to irrigate his farm. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and pipes to irrigate his farm.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia, 37, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past four years, Zakia has operated a restaurant business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a retail shop in the future.

Zakia plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and cereals.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children and three go to school. She has two additional family members. She has a bar. She sells her products on a wholesale and retail basis from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for 30 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a fridge, more crates of beer, soda and jerrycans of local gin. Her major business challenges are transportation and electricity. Her aspiration goals are to own a fully stocked pub and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, jerrycans of local gin and a refrigerator

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is taking another Kiva loan of KSHS 20,000 to boost her food stall business. With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase more sacks of potatoes. She dreams of expanding her business to get more profit and boost her living standards. Thanks to Kiva lenders and Yehu for giving her an opportunity to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a married woman with five children. Her husband is a painter who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Anastasia has operated a retail shop for the past 30 years; her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough clients. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more detergent, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même localité. Elles se sont unies par affinité et par amitié. Elles mènent des activités diverses (petit commerce, artisanat, élevage etc.)

KHADY, debout à l'extrême de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de poisson, d'habits et de chaussures. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises ci-dessus pour mieux satisafaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus

Son objectif en tant que veuve est de prendre en charge la scolarité la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants. Par ailleurs, elle voudrait renforcer son niveau d'épargne et investir dans un projet immobilier
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 14, 2010. It is made up of 17 women who are all from the same locale. They united out of affinity and friendship. They manage a variety of businesses (shopkeeping, crafts, breeding, etc.).

Khady, standing on the far side of the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 48 years old. She is a widow and mother to six children.

She is a shopkeeper selling fish, outfits and shoes. She has been practicing this business for several years.

With her new loan she is going to reinforce her stock of the above merchandise to better satisfy her clientèle and increase her income.

Her goal as a widow is to take care of her children's schooling, food and health. Besides, she would like to increase her savings and invest in a housing project.

loans.use: to buy fish, outfits, and shoes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man. He has a son who is 12 years old. He describes himself as generous. He operates a business providing motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located within a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the 15,000 KES loan to add to his savings and buy another motorbike. Robert's business goal is to own four more motorbikes within five years.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with four children and all go to school. She has no additional family member. She has a kiosk selling soft drinks at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for four years. She works six days a week. She has requested for loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a fridge, sugar, passion fruits, crates of soda and boxes of mineral water. Her major challenge is transportation. Her aspiration and goal is to see her business grow big so that she can open up another branch in the same market. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent .

loans.use: to buy a fridge, sugar, passion friuts, oranges, crates of soda and boxes of mineral water.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a single man, and has no children yet. He describes himself to be a go-getter and a humble man. He operates a retail store where he sells maize, and has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located within a shopping centre. 

He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase more bags of maize for selling. Bonface's business goal is to be selling maize in wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for selling.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is applying for another loan to start a fish selling business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase fish, cooking oil and to put up a stall for her new business. In the future, Fatuma aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Fatuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase fish, cooking oil and a stall for her new business.

loans.name: Katsaka

texts.en:
Katsaka is applying for another loan to start a charcoal selling business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Katsaka aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Katsaka has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married, and her husband is a business man. They have two children aged 12 and 16 years old who live at home and attend school.

For the past ten years Christiana has been selling coal and pepper. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal and pepper for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more coal and pepper to sell

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma, aged 30, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business and a second hand clothes selling business. She sells her clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing clothes at the market for resale. Rahma dreams of expanding and establishing a shop at the market to sell her products.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is applying for another loan to expand her samosa business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase bales of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. In the future, Mwanaisha aspires to continue improving her enterprise.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanaisha has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Agriphina

texts.en: Agriphina is a 43-year-old married woman. She has four children, whose ages range from 10 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be polite, ambitious, and kind. She operates a retail store where she sells maize, millet, and sorghum and provides services of grinding maize into flour. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy and less competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating price of maize. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bags of maize, millet, and sorghum. Agriphina's business goal is to be selling cereals wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and sorghum for grinding and then selling.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 42 años de estado civil Casada vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

María Teresa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una refrigeradora para su casa porque la comida se esta dañando.
Le gusta lavar la ropa en el rio y planchar.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, in the Los Ríos province.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to L. Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  María Teresa is a farmer who has grown corn and rice for several years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them both in Ventanas and in Pueblo Viejo canton.

The loan requested is to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizers for sewing the corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income for her family and to be able to invest.  Her dream is to buy a refrigerator for her home because their food goes off.

She enjoys washing her clothes in the river and ironing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid feritlizers

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Kibibi has operated a food stall for the past five years; her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities. She dreams of establishing a restaurant.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Sop Nabi Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même localité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame MAREME, debout à l'extrême de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle développe un petit commerce d'encens et de parfums. elle s'approvisionne au grand marche de la ville et revend dans son quartier. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises ci-dessus afin d'accroître ses revenus financiers. 

Son objectif est d'augmenter ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois, de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans la gestion financière de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 14, 2010. It consists of 17 women from the same locality. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Mareme, standing at the far right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 38 years old. She is married with four children.

She runs a small business selling incense and perfume. She buys her merchandise at the Grand market, in the city, and conducts her sales in her neighborhood. With many years of experience, she has a good command of her activity. 

This new loan will allow her to replenish her stock and increase her revenue. 

Her goals are to bolster her savings with the Banc Villageois, provide for her personal needs, and assist her husband with the family’s financial management.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
María Norma tiene 33 años de estado civil Casada vive con el esposo   y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

María Norma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar una desgranadora.

Le gusta lavar la ropa de su esposo y de los hijos.
texts.en:
María Norma is 33 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in the los Ríos province.

The Vencedores Unidos communal bank is located Anchoveta, on the road to the community of La Templanza in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. María Norma is a farmer who has grown corn and rice for several years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market here and also in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. 

The requested loan is to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer for sewing the corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income for her family and to be able to invest. Her dream is to have enough money to buy a husking machine.  

She enjoys washing her husband's and children’s clothes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Sikuku

texts.en:
Sikuku is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her major dream is to establish a place to sell food in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat oil and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat oil and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 29, is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a low number of customers during the months of March to June, while over the holidays the demand is high. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for the business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 35-year-old single lady who lives in a rental house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Beatrice has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with three children and one goes to school. She has one additional family member (cousin). She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and shoes. 

Esther's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her aspiration is to start selling wholesale and also to build a house. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is applying for another loan to expand her tailoring business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase a new sewing machine for her business. In the future, Charlotte aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Charlotte has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and she thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes issues de différents quartiers. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par amitié. Leur activité principale est le petit l'artisanat et la coiffure. 

Madame ANTA, debout à l'extrême de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d'un de ses neveux.

Elle détentrice d'un réfrigérateur qui lui permet de développe un petit commerce de crème et de glace. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de dix ans années. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter du pain de singe, des fleures d'oseil séchées et du sucre pour bien mener son activité

. Son objectif est d'augmenter ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois, de faire la promotion de son activité et de prendre en charge sa progéniture et son neveu.
texts.en:
This group was established on May 14, 2010. It is made up of 13 women who come from different neighborhoods. They got together based on affinities and friendship. Their main businesses are handicraft and hairdressing.

Mrs. Anta, standing  on the side in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 55 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children. She also has one of her nephews to support.

She owns a refrigerator, which enable her to run a business selling cream and ice. She has a good experience in this field, due to the fact n for more than ten years.

Her new loan will enable her to buy monkey breads (baobab tree fruits), dried sorrel flowers, and sugar for her business.

Her goal is to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois, promote her business, and take care of her children and her nephew.

loans.use: to buy monkey breads (baobab tree fruits), dried sorrel flowers, and sugar

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is taking another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES to boost her poultry business. With the loan, she wants to purchase 300 poultry chicks and chicken feed. Agnes dreams of expanding her chicken house to accommodate 10,000 chickens in the future. The loan has improved her family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and 300 poultry chicks

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of Irish potatoes, green yams, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. In the future, Mwanamkasi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanamkasi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Irish potatoes, green yams, cooking oil and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is taking a bigger Kiva loan of 25,000 KES to boost his vegetable stall business. With the loan, he wants to purchase more stocks of green vegetables, onions and tomatoes. Paul dreams of establishing another business in the future to earn more profit and build his home. He thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving him an opportunity to access more loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of green vegetables, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ambrocio, a retired policeman. She is mother to their 4 children; 2 are in college while one is still in high school and one in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vivian operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for computers, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. Vivian rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy computer spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vivian hopes to to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and accessories needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en: Raheli, 38, is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business from her home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future. With her KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth, sewing threads and embroidery for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sewing threads and embroidery for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, who is 54 and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Raniel, a laborer, and is the mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Yolanda’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since Yolanda’s stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, Yolanda is requesting a PHP10,000 loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, and also used bags and footwear. If she can roll the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Yolanda hopes to to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of used clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Felix Ruperto

texts.es:
Felix Ruperto tiene 35 años de estado civil Soltero vive solo no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Felix Ruperto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Guaranda y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los Cantones de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es seguir aumentando la cantidad de producción del maíz sobre todo.

En los tiempos libres disfruta mucho ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Felix Rupert is 35 years old, single with no children, and lives alone. He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province.

The communal bank is called Ciudadela Los Ángeles, and is located in the area of Los Ángeles, belonging to the Ventanas Canton and this area is devoted to agricultural work of short-cycle growing of corn and rice.

Felix Ruperto works in agriculture growing corn and rice. He buys his products in Guaranda and he sells in the market there and in the markets of the surrounding cantons.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizers for the growing of corn and rice. The loan will help him increase his income for the use of his family and to invest. His dream is to continue increasing his corn production above all.

In his free time he very much enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina, aged 33, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rodel, a driver, and is the mother of her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Monina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
