Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwamali has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 52 years old, married and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She earns about PHP 10,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport her passengers. Last year, Adelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and life. In the future, she hopes to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in a transportation business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer. She has been a tailor for the past two years earning a monthly income of 7,800 KES, which she uses to support her family.

Elizabeth is requesting for her first loan from KADET, which she will use to buy clothe materials. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her dream is to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothe for making dresses.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a sari sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, egg, spices, bread, etc.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has four children. 

Rosa has a poultry farm and a shop that sells mature chickens and eggs.  She has operated this business for 15 years.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP in order to buy feed for the chickens.

Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Mercedes provides the motorcycle with a sidecar where she has a hired driver for her motorcycle. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

Mercedes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercedes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 53-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has no children yet and hopes to have one soon.

Carmelita has had a sari-sari store business for a year. She sells items like soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap and spices. Carmelita earns 4,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks.

In the future, Carmelita hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
60-year-old Cristina is a married woman with two children aged 26 and 22. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Cristina has had a sari-sari store business for more than 10 years. She sells various items like soft drinks and canned goods. Cristina earns 3,500 PHP per month with her sari-sari store. Cristina also helps her husband sell fish to their community. Cristina works hard to support her family.

Cristina plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets and traps and more items to sell at her store. In the future, Cristina hopes

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and traps for her husband and more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en: Benedictor is a 38-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 11 years old. He describes himself to be focused and principled. He operates a retail business where he sells sand, charcoal and wood. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs four staff members. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are traders from his town area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a cow of milk for selling. His business goal is to expand his retail business within five years. Benedictor's plan for his family is to educate his children and build them a house.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sidi est âgée de 42 ans, mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou.
Ayant abandonnée l’école au secondaire (système éducatif Malien), tôt elle embrassa le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments et de l’encense. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, elle  évolua seule  pour faire le même  commerce. Elle mène son activité depuis maintenant 7 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son produit. Elle  vend sa marchandise au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
 Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle  sollicite ce nouveau prêt. elle  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois, avec 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. 
Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour acheter 50 kg de kéni et 20 bouteilles d’eaux de Cologne.  Elle  s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.
Madame Fatoumata Sidi envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt, de mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
 Son ambition est   de pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Sidi is 42 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her nuclear family in the Hamdallayein district of the town of Ségou.

She left school during secondary level (in the Malian education system) and started working with her mother at a young age, selling condiments and incense. Having worked for several years as her mother´s apprentice, Fatoumata Sidi struck out on her own, continuing in the same line of work. She has now been in this business for 7 years and is very experienced. The strength of her sales is due to the high quality of her product. She sells her merchandise for cash or credit to a clientele mostly composed of women.

Fatoumata Sidi is requesting a new loan so that she can better respond to customer demand and make more profits. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for of 24 months and has already fully repaid 2 previous individual loans. She is requesting this third loan so that she can buy 50g of guéni (natural incense) and 20 bottles of Eau de Cologne. She gets her supplies locally, in Ségou.

Fatoumata Sidi anticipates earning a monthly profit of 45 000 francs. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and pursue other revenue-generating activities. Her goal is to make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make incense.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mamadou est âgé de 41 ans,  marié et père de 1 enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou.
Mamadou est titulaire d’un certificat d’aptitude professionnelle en déclarant en douane, mais faute d’emploi, il décide de faire une reconversion afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique. C’est ainsi qu’il commença à faire l’apprenti cameraman auprès des professionnelles de l’Office de Radio diffusion Télévision du Mali (O.R.T.M). Après plusieurs années à leurs côtés, il évolua seul  pour faire le métier de cameraman. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son service offert. 
Dans le souci de mieux s’équiper pour faire face à la demande clientèle, il sollicite ce prêt. Il est à son 1er prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte l’utiliser  pour payer une camera, il s’approvisionnera au Ghana. Il fait ses prestations au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Avec ce prêt, il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice de 40 000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de faire face à la demande clientèle et de payer ses échéances avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou is 41 years old, and married with one child. He lives in a traditional family among other households in the district of Hamdallaye, in Segou. Mamadou holds a vocational training certificate as a customs officer, but due to a lack of employment opportunities, he opted to switch to a different career in order to enter the work force. He became an apprentice cameraman working with professionals at the Office for Radio and Television of Mali (ORTM). After several years of training, he branched out on his own to work as a cameraman. His main strength is in the quality of his services.

In order to be better equipped to meet customer demand, Mamadou is seeking his first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to purchase a camera, which he plans to buy in Ghana. He works for cash, and his clientele consists of both men and women. He expects that this loan will help him to earn a profit of 40,000FCFA per month. This will allow him to handle customer demand and make loan repayments to Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr: Madame Fatou habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants âgés entre 8 et 26 ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10ans dans le secteur de la petite  restauration et vend du petit déjeuner et du  sandwich. En meme temps elle commercialise des tissus teintés, et des blousons. Elle a choisi son activité de commerce  pour épauler son mari a supporter les charges familiales.  Ce qui l’intéresse  c’est surtout l’aspect   lucratif de  cette activité. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné a renforcer son fond  de commerce  pour augmenter le stock  des produits qu’elle commercialise ( tissus teintés, blousons) d’une part, d’autre part elle compte renforcer son commerce de petit déjeuner  en achetant en quantité plus importante les denrées qu’elle utilise préparer ses repas. Son souhait  est d’augmenter ses bénéfices et d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 43, married and the mother of 5 children aged between 8 and 26. She has been working as a restaurateur for over 10 years and sells breakfasts and sandwiches. She also sells dyed fabrics and jackets. She chose her business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and she is especially interested in the profitable aspects of her work.

Fatou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since November 2003. She is requesting a 300 000 franc loan so that she can strengthen her business activities by restocking on the products that she sells (dyed fabrics and jackets) and buying larger quantities of the ingredients that she uses to make her breakfasts. She would like to increase her profits and improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: to buy fabric, jackets and food products for her business.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et de 4 enfants en moyenne. Elles vivent  dans des  familles polygames dans la ville de Bougouni, au quartier de Médine.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles se sont connues par les liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et des fruits et légumes.
FANTA, est la présidente du groupe, elle est devant avec a un panier de tomate fraîche contenant un peu de choux, sur son pied. 
Elle compte acheter, avec son prêt, 400 kg de tomate fraîche, 300kg de choux et divers petits colis de condiments(fièfiè, poivre, poudre de gombo et de Sounbala). Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako avec les grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour soutenir les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The BADEGNA group consists of married women who average 29 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in the city of Bougouni, located in the Medina district. They know one another as neighbors and through their trade. They sell food condiments, fruits and vegetables. This is their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans were repaid without problems.

FANTA is the president of the group. She is sitting at the front in the photo with a basket of fresh tomatoes and cabbage. She will use her loan to purchase 400 kg of fresh tomatoes, 300 kg of cabbage, and various small packets of condiments (fièfiè, pepper, okra powder and Sounbala). She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Bamako, and she conducts her sales at retail at the big market of Bougouni and from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, part of which is to be used to cover the costs of the children’s healthcare and education, and the remainder to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments, fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENDIYA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, époux et enfants. Elles résident dans le village de SIDO, préfecture de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Pour améliorer leurs activités afin de mieux satisfaire les clients, elles ont fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec la quelle elles sont à leur douzième prêts et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ces femmes du groupe BENDIYA font le commerce de céréales, de pagnes et de chaussures.
Djakassan, deuxième personne la photo qui souri avec une tasse de céréales sur son pied, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 300kg de maïs, 200kkg de petit mil et 250kg de fonio. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de SIDO avec les fournisseurs venus des villages environnants pour ensuite les revendre sur place en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENDIYA group are all married, are aged on average thirty-four years, and have an average of four children. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, husbands, and children. They live in the village of SIDO in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali.
To improve their businesses in order to better satisfy their customers, they have appealed to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are at their twelfth loan with this institution, and all of their previous loans were properly repaid. 
The women from the BENDIYA group do business in grains, pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and shoes.
 Djakassan, the second person in the photo who is smiling and has a cup of grains at her feet, counts on buying with this loan 300kg of corn, 200kg of millet and 250kg of fonio (another type of millet). She stocks up in the SIDO market with the sellers who come from neighboring villages so that she can then resell on the premises to retail customers, both women and men.
She imagines making a monthly profit averaging 45,000francs, which will be invested into her activity.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de SIDO, préfecture de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des produits cosmétiques, de mèches, etc.
CHATA, qui est la présidente du groupe ayant un paquet de mèche tendu dans ses deux mains sur la photo, compte acheter avec son prêt, 400 paquets de mèche de diverses qualités avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de SIDO à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour entretenir les enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the DEMBAGNOUMA group are all married, are aged on average twenty-six years, and have on average three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Sido, in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are at their eighth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The group of women does business selling cosmetics, hair extensions, etc.
Chata, who is the president of the group, with a packet of hair extensions in her hands in the photo, counts on buying 400 packs of hair extensions from the wholesalers in Bamako with this loan, which she will then sell retail, for cash and for credit, in the Sido market to a clientele essentially made up of women. 
She imagines making an average monthly profit of 50,000francs, of which one part will be used to look after her children and the other part will be invested in her occupation.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to equip her canteen.

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Composé de quatre femmes mariées, les membres du groupe MIRIYA ont en moyenne 28 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, épouses, coépouses, frères et fils. Elles résident dans le village de SIDO, préfecture de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des clients de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire le stock, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur douzième prêt et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce jus, de boissons sucreries.
FANTA, présidente du groupe habillée en complet rougeâtre sur la photo compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 casiers de boisson non alcoolisées (sucrerie) avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de SIDO à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Made up of four married women, the members of the group MIRIYA are aged on average twenty-eight years and have an average of two children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons. They live in the village of Sido, in the prefecture of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali.
They got to know each other from customers, being neighbors, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capacity, in order to better stock up, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and with which they are at their twelfth loan. All previous loans have been properly repaid. The group of women does business in juice and sweet drinks.
Fanta, the president of the group, in the reddish outfit in the photo, counts on buying 150 bottle racks of non alcoholic drinks from wholesalers in Bamako with their loan, which she will then resell commercially, for cash and credit in the Sido market to a clientele made up of both men and women.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 40,000francs, which will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Elizah

texts.en:
Elizah, 45 years old, is a dairy farmer in Mariakani. She is the married mother of two. 

She has been selling milk to her customers for the past ten years successfully.

This marks her first loan business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to buy more dairy cattle and goats. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to have a happy, successful family.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cattle and goats.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar  est âgé de 45 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 1et 7 ans.  Il s’active depuis 1992 dans l’enseignement coranique  dans le quartier ou il habite. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est le savoir qu’il inculque aux enfants. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité  depuis octobre 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour soutenir ses frères pécheurs qui ont des possibilité très limitées et qui veulent entretenir leur pirogue qui est en état de délabrement avancé. Son  objectif est d’aider ses frères à maintenir leur capacité financière a  supporter les charges familiales.
texts.en: Monsieur Momar is forty-five years old. He lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of four children, whose ages range from one to seven years. He has been active since 1992 teaching the Koran in the area where he lives. What interests him the most is the knowledge that he imparts to the children. He has been a member of his UIMCEC branch since October 2003. He is asking for a loan of 150,000, anticipated to help his brothers, who are fishermen, who have very limited possibilities and want to take care of their canoe, which is badly in disrepair. His objective is to help his brothers maintain their financial capacity to support their family expenses.

loans.use: to help his brothers repair their canoe.

loans.name: Journy

texts.en: Journy is 30 years old, single and lives in Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Journy owned a sari-sari store for 1 year, earning PHP 5,000 monthly. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Journy has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Journy hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has nine children. 

Crisanta has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

Crisanta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, ages 8 and 10. For the past year, she has run an M-pesa transaction service which is a cell phone-based money transfer service. Everlyne describes herself as social and focused. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are local residents and passersby. Everlyne's business challenge is inadequate float. 

Everlyne is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to increase her transaction capital. She will deposit her loan in a Safaricom account. Everlyne's business goal is to run three similar businesses within the next five years.

loans.use: to increase her money transfer service

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah  is a hairdresser. She owns a beauty salon at Adum Banso. Monica has completed Junior High Senior.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a purching clerk. Hannah has been a hairdresser for 6 years. Her loan will be used to buy hair creams and wigs for hair dressing business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy hair creams and wigs for hair dressing business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
"Our business in life is not to get ahead of others, but to get ahead of ourselves." (E. Joseph Cossman). 

Cresencia has been a businesswoman for one year. She is 52 years old and married. She resides at Aquino, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and is blessed with four siblings at school age. 

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months already and she borrowed money in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for additional business capital. Her business is a sari-sari store. She earns about Php 5,000 monthly in her business as profit. She improves her living conditions with the use of the profits.

loans.use: to use as business additional capital.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
"The spirit, the will to win, and the will to excel are the things that endure. These qualities are so much more important than the events that occur." (Vince Lombardi). 

Silveria has the strong determination to help her brother. She is 60 years old and married to Meguel, who is a government employee with a salary of Php 6,000, and she is blessed with a daughter.

She is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she borrowed money in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for pocket money for her brother who is going abroad.

loans.use: to give pocket money to her brother who is going abroad.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin lives in Pingol, Ozamiz City. He is 56 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. For more than 3 years, he has made a living by selling food & daily use products in the local community. He earns about 10,000 PHP a month from his work. In 2010, Delfin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for this loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offering. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 21-year-old married woman with four children ranging from 7 to 20 years old. For the past six years, she has operated a restaurant where she sells snacks, tea, and food. She also is a farmer who grows maize and green grams. Dorcas describes herself as innovative, creative, and aggressive. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of buying ingredients to prepare food. 

Dorcas is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, and green grams. Her business goal is to run a hotel where she can sell a variety of food within five years.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, salt, and green grams

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 8 children. 

Rosalinda has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & candies. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more snacks, beverages & candies to sell.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & candies

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Berlinda has a vulcanizing shop that provides motor repairs & tire repairs, with her husband as the repairman. She has had this business for 10 years.

Berlinda requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the electricity for her business.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Berlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tools & pay for electricity

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson used his previous loan to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business. Since his dream is educating his children and increase his daily savings, he intends to buy more motorcycles and hire them out, having discovered this business as a direct answer to his dream. Wilson needs this loan to buy a second motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 27-year old married man with two children, living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He provides motorcycle transport services and has been in that business for six years.  He also rears cattle.  His challenge has been high fuel costs and accidents.  His dream is to buy another motorcycle and expand his cattle farm.  Godfrey needs this loan to to buy a cow for milking.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her two children who are in high school.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a forty-two-year-old married man with five children. He rears goats and grows flowers in Kangemi. Lucas has been in the business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Lucas’ third loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goats to rear and sell later at a profit,and also plant flowers for sell. 

With the profit that he will get he wants to diversify in his business. In the future he wants to be able to expand his business and sustain his family by improving their standard of living

loans.use: to buy goats and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 26-year-old modest lady from Lambwe town, Western Kenya. She is married to Patrick and they have two children.
Caroline operates a home products stall in Lambwe town where she sells items such as water basins, buckets, cups and other utensils. She has been doing this for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from Kiva partner KADET, which she will use to buy a stock of home products such as basins and buckets. She will use her profits to purchase more stock. Her dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy stocks of home products (such as basins and buckets) for resale.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 15, 14 and 10.  In 1998, she established  her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chickens for her business.  

In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens for her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells are fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, palm oil, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items at Adum Banso near Takoradi.  She is married to a farmer and has five dependents.  Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their dependents.  

Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items for resale. With her new profit, Ama will expand Ekua business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Adum Banso. She is married to a teacher and has one child. Lydia has been baking for three years now.  She supports her husband to feed and clothe their children. 

She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Sarait

texts.en: Sarait, 35, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately US $2.5 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns approximately US $3 per day. In order to develop her family's economy, Sarait is requesting a loan of US $350 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to repair motorbikes for his clients. By doing so, her husband will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband's business

loans.name: Lib 6 Sous Groupe 2

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté6 sous groupe 2  un regroupement  de 13 membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe de 11 femmes  regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Elles sont représentées par madame  Ndeye Aissatou  qui représente la personne habillée en  vert  sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur du commerce de produits divers  et de la couture. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 17 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l »’achat d’habits a revendre. Son objectif  est de diversifier les produits et l’habillement qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite élargir sa part de marché et ouvrir d’autres magasins afin de pouvoir maximiser ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Al OUMA Liberté 6 sub-group 2 consists of 13 affiliates under the same association, which is a national solidarity group.  This is a group of 11 women brought together in the same industry of diverse retail businesses.

They are represented by Ms. Ndetye Aissatou, depicted in the photo wearing green.  She has been active for many years in retail dealing with various goods as well as clothing. She capitalizes on an experience of more than ten years in these sectors.  She begins her days at 9:00 in the morning and returns home around 5:00 in the evening.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase garments for resale.  Her goal is to diversify her retail clothing products. She wishes to expand her market share and open other stores in order to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to purchase garments and various goods for resale.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib 6Sous Groupe 1

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté6 sous groupe 1 est   un regroupement  de 11  membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe de 11 femmes  regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Elles sont représentées par madame   Aissata   qui représente la personne habillée en  marron  avec une voile  sur la tête  sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur du commerce de  tissus  et de la couture. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 15 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus a confectionner et d’autres produits comme sacs et chaussures  dans le but de diversifier ses marchandises.. Son objectif  est d’ouvrir un magasin dans un futur proche.
texts.en:
Al  Ouma Liberté 6Sous Groupe 1 is made up of 11 members who all belong to the same association, a national solidarity group. It is a group of 11 women gathered together in the same sector, miscellaneous trade.

The women are represented by Ms. Aissata, the woman shown dressed in brown with a veil on her head in the photo. For several years, she has been very busy in the fabric and fashion trade. She makes the most of her experience of more than 15 years in this business. She begins her day at 10am, returning home around 7pm.

Ms. Aissata is seeking a loan intended for purchasing fabrics to prepare and other goods, such as bags and shoes, with the aim of diversifying her merchandise. Her intention is to open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, bags, shoes and various goods to sell.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib1, 2, 3, Sous Groupe 3

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté1, 2, 3, sous groupe 3 est   un regroupement  de 10  membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe mixte de 9 femmes et un homme regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Ils  sont représentées par madame   Bernadette   qui représente la personne habillée en  rouge sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur  de la transformation et du commerce d’articles divers de femmes. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 18 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de produits divers pour femmes marchandises. Son objectif  est d’acquérir le fond nécessaire pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en: Al Ouma  liberté 1, 2, 3 (subgroup 3) is a group which consists of 10 members who have all joined the same national solidarity association.  This is a mixed group, with 9 women and 1 man who are all involved in various trades.  Bernadette is their representative, and she is the woman dressed in red in the photo.  For several years now, she has been involved in the processing and the sale of various women's products.  She has acquired  over ten years of experience in these fields.  She starts her day at 9 o'clock in the morning and returns home at about 6 o'clock in the evening.  She is requesting a loan to purchase various women's products.  Her goal is to acquire enough funding to diversify her activity.

loans.use: to buy women's products for resale.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib 1, 2, ,3,sous Groupe 2

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté1, 2, 3, sous groupe 2 est   un regroupement  de 9  membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe  de 9 femmes regroupées dans le meme secteur d’activité de la couture et de  commerce de tissus et  divers autres produits. Elles   sont représentées par madame  Fatou    qui représente la personne habillée en  jaune sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de tissus  et produits divers. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle a  19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés à renforcer son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite dans l’avenir diversifier son activité le maximum  possible.
texts.en: Al Ouma Liberté 1, 2, 3, Sous Group 2 is a grouping of nine members who all belong to the same association which is a national solidarity group. This group of nine women are in the same business sector of sewing, fabric, and various other products. Fatou, the person dressed in yellow in the photo, represents the women. For more than ten years she has been very involved with the fabric business and of various other products. She capitalizes on her experience of more than ten years in these businesses and begins her day from 9 in the morning in order to return home by 7 in the evening. She seeks a planned loan to buy fabric intended to reinforce her commerce activity. She wishes to diversify her business as much as possible in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a variety of articles to sell.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib1, 2, 3, Sous Groupe 4

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté1, 2, 3, sous groupe 4 est   un regroupement  de 7 membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe  de  7 femmes regroupées dans le meme secteur d’activité de la couture et de  commerce de tissus et  divers autres produits. Elles   sont représentées par madame  Aissatou  qui représente la personne habillée en   vert sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de tissus  et produits divers. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plusieurs années dans son activité. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle à  19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de produits cosmétiques  puisqu’elle a l’intention de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise. Son objectif principal est de  renforcer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Al Ouma Liberté 1, 2, 3, Sous Group 4 is a grouping of seven members who all belong to the same association which is a national solidarity group. This group of seven women are in the same business sector of sewing, fabric, and various other products. Aissatou, the person dressed in green in the photo, represents the women. For more than ten years she has been very involved in the fabric business and of various other products. She capitalizes on her experience of several years in her business and begins her day from 10 in the morning in order to return home by 7 in the evening. She seeks a planned loan to buy fabric and cosmetics since she intends to diversify the products that she sells. Her main objective is to reinforce her commerce activity.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other various products to sell.

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Bevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits, milk, coffee, shampoos and soap. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more goods like canned goods biscuits and all food products to sell.

Bevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more good lto sell like canned goods, biscuits, and other food products to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has seven children ranging from fifteen to eighteen years old. She describes herself as self-motivated and aggressive. She has been involved in dairy farming where she sells milk to repeat customers. In addition, she does farming to increase her income. Her business challenge is the high cost of cow feed. 

Margaret will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy three bags of cow feed and milk storage containers. In the next five years, Margaret hope to be the best supplier of milk and have three more cows.

loans.use: to buy three bags of  cow feed and milk storage containers.

loans.name: Fredy Boanerge

texts.es:
Fredy, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus dos hijos, sus hijos dependen de él; Fredy administra  una tienda de productos domésticos, esta surgió por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido y cuenta con experiencia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como frijoles, huevos, aceite, esta compra le permitirá tener más disponibilidad para la clientela, ampliando el negocio para satisfacer la demanda.
La aspiración de Fredy es que su negocio sea prospero, para poder de esta manera generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy lives with his family, his wife, and his two children. His children depend on him. Fredy runs a store that sells household items, which he began on his own initiative. He does not have a fixed schedule and is experienced. 

He is asking for a loan for the purchase of essential items, like beans, eggs, and oil. This purchase will allow him to have more available for the customer, expanding the business to satisfy demand. 

Fredy's goal is for his business to be lucrative so that through this he can make money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase beans, eggs, and oil.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty-eight-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He owns a big car that transports people and their products to Kamwenge markets as a source of income. His challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and poor roads subjecting his car to repair expenses all the time.  His dream is educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Stephen needs this loan to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: buy tires

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 48-year-old, hardworking lady with 6 children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a personal goal of buying a car. She has been dealing in clothes-selling for the last 10 years. After starting with capital of 100,000 UGX, Ruth now has 3,000,000 UGX. Her major hardship is seasonal weather. However, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent location. Ruth needs a loan to help her buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is married and has 4 children.  He is 60 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Luciano operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  Each month, he earns 4,600 PHP doing this type of business.

Luciano requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair his fishing boat.  In 2011, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Luciano wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 56 years old and married to a businessman. They have 4 children, whose ages range from 21 years to 36 years. She describes herself as an industrious woman. She operates a pig farm where she sells pigs and pork. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a viable and busy area. Her customers are schools. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ten piglets. Sarah's business goal is to run a pork butcher shop within 5 years. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be the area's leading supplier of meat.

loans.use: to purchase ten piglets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Joseph. He is married, and has 4 children aged 14, 11, 6, and 2yrs. Joseph established his  provision business. He began his business because he wanted to get a reliable source of income which he can use to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.Joseph now requires a new loan in order to purchase more provision for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Joseph plans to open stores in different market areas and educate his children to university level. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Mareidel

texts.en:
Mareidel is 32 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is married with one school-aged child. 

To earn a living, Mareidel has a business selling of different kinds of viands (prepared dishes). She earns about 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Mareidel has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.

Mareidel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Mareidel would like to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 24 years old and married with one child. 

He runs a hardware shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year and employs three people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tiles to sell.

loans.use: to buy tiles to sell

loans.name: Janneth Cecilia

texts.es:
Janneth ha trabajado durante gran parte de su vida con el ánimo de sacar su familia adelante. Anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo morcilla en su municipio, pues los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, y gracias a esto la gente del pueblo logró conocerla. Posteriormente, un amigo suyo que preparaba pizzas en un carrito de comidas tuvo que abandonar el municipio, por lo que le enseñó a Janneth la actividad y le dejó su carrito de comidas, a partir de esto Janneth siguió elaborando las pizzas ya que esto le dejaba mejores ingresos. Ahora que Janneth es reconocida por las personas de su municipio sus ventas son muy buenas, hasta el punto que a veces su negocio no tiene la capacidad de preparar las pizzas para tantas personas que le compran. Es por esto que Janneth quiere cambiar su carrito de comidas, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de este, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un carrito de comidas para preparar pizza y a la compra utensilios de cocina para la preparación de las pizzas. 

Janneth sueña con tener un gran local donde pueda atender a muchas personas y donde pueda estar cubierta si empieza a llover. Además, sueña con que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y puedan tener una estabilidad económica que les permita tener mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Janneth has worked for most of her life with the intention of getting her family ahead. Before she worked selling blood sausage in her town, since the income generated by her husband wasn't enough to sustain their home. Thanks to this, the people of the town got to know her. Later on, a friend of hers who made pizzas in a food cart had to leave town, so he taught Janneth the work and left her his food cart. Since then, Janneth continued making pizzas since this gave her a greater income.

Now that she is recognized by the townspeople her sales are very good--to the point where sometimes her business doesn't have the capacity to make pizzas for all the people who want to buy from her. It is because of this that Janneth wants to change her food cart. However, she doesn't have sufficient capital to buy this, so she is hoping that a loan will provide her with the opportunity to purchase a food cart to make pizzas and to buy kitchen utensils for making the pizzas.

Janneth dreams of having a big place where she can wait on many people and where she can be covered if it starts to rain. Furthermore, she dreams that her children receive a good education and that they have economic stability that allows them greater opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy a food cart to make pizza, and to buy kitchen utensils for making pizzas.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past year, John has been working hard to manage his small shop, which does produce in food. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for produce, and will help John to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. John hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food for produce

loans.name: Atambula Empola Zakaliya Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Moses has been a retail trader for the last five years. The father of five plies his trade in Kayunga. He deals principally in general merchandise retail commodities such as sugar, salt, plastics, rice, beans, etc. On the side, too, he practices farming. Week In, week out, he says his sales revenue equals to UGX 150,000.

Moses says he intends to use his loan money to purchase more goods: sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and maize flour to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more goods: sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and maize flour to resell.

loans.name: Adolfo Arnoldo

texts.es:
Don Adolfo tiene 44 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mamá. Desde los 15 años de edad trabaja en la agricultura en fincas de café, cultivos frutales, entre otros, él trabaja muy fuerte para ayudar a su mamá y salir adelante.

Los abonos químicos que necesita para mantener los cultivos, los compra en la ciudad más cercana, para abordar el autobús que lo conduzca ahí, tiene que caminar a pie durante cuarenta y cinco minutos.

Don Adolfo solicita el financiamiento a Fundación Campo, para comprar 4 quintales de abono y follares para mantener el cultivo de plátanos que posee y la finca de café. 

Con la inversión aprovechara los recursos que posee, ya que cuenta con cultivos de plátanos, naranjas y finca de cafés, para abonarlas y que le produzcan una buena cosecha, para que sus ingresos sean mejores y brindarle lo necesario a su mamá ya que tiene una avanzada edad.

Don Adolfo tiene pensado construir una casa de ladrillo e instalar la energía eléctrica, además darle las mejores condiciones a su mamá.
texts.en:
Don Adolfo is 44 years old. He is single, and lives with his mom.  Since the age of 15, he has worked in agriculture in coffee plantations and with fruit crops among others.  He works very hard to support his mother and to move ahead in life.

He purchases the chemical fertilizers that he needs to maintain his crops in the nearest city.  In order to catch the bus that goes there, he has to walk 45 minutes.

Don Adolfo is requesting financing from Fundación Campo to purchase four quintales (about 400 lb total) of fertilizers and foliant insecticide to maintain his plantain crop and coffee plantation.  With the investment he will be able to take advantage of the resources that he possesses, as he has plantain and orange crops, and a coffee plantation.  He will be able to fertilize them and they will produce a good harvest, so that his income is better and he can provide his mom with what she needs as she is of an advanced age.

Don Adolfo has been thinking about building a stone house and installing electricity, and also providing better conditions for his mom.

loans.use: to purchase four quintales (about 400 lb total) of fertilizers and foliant insecticide to maintain his plantain crop and coffee plantation.

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en: Lodivina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store and farming, selling a variety of different products in the local community and per cropping she is selling corn . She has been engaged in her farming business for over six years to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow for her farming business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is very cooperative and supports her family by working as a farmer. She is still very efficient at the age of 43 and also performs her household duties very well. Her husband is a farmer and they help each other. Elisa is the mother of a son and a daughter. 

Elisa has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner for her farming business. With the loan investment, she will buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, which will allow her to get maximum output from her land and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow her farming business

loans.name: Angoritas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS DE 25 DE JULIO” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado. Tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, artesanía, transporte público.

La señora Julia,  indica que es el primer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una de las promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá la agencia distribuidora, por mayor, y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación y salud.

En la fotografía no aparese la señora Carmen, ya que ella tuvo que incorporarse inmediatamente a su fuente laboral.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Angoritas de 25 de Julio" will take their second loan with Pro Mujer. The group is part of the Andes regional office and is made up of eight members. It is run by a board headed by Julia. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are fish sales, blanket weaving, vegetable sales, handicrafts, and public transport. 

Julia states that this is her first year working with Pro Mujer and she came to the institution through the invitation of one of the facilitators. Currently she has a handicrafts business that she has worked in for years. 

The loan she is taking now will be used to increase her capital (purchasing wool) which she will get from the distribution agency at wholesale. After making her items she will sell them from her home. This for of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and health.

Carmen is not pictured in the photograph as she had to had leave immediately for work.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Agricultural business has been the main primary source of income of Zenaida's family. She is 40 years old and happily married.The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children who goes to school.

Zenaida have been operating her two hectares of rice field for almost 20 years.She would like to develop her agricultural business so that she could gain more income.Due to shortage of capital,Zenaida would like to borrow loan amount of P50,000 which will be use in buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of raised crops. This loan amount will really help her to earn for greater profit to be able to ensure sustainable future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farming business

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a happy man. His boutique business has improved. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He is now applying for his second loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He intends to use the loan to stock up his business with more hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes. 

He will save the anticipated profit and help take care of his children. In the future, Ernest hopes to expand his shop and also venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to stock up his business with more hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes.

loans.name: Kambeng De Diende Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kambeng de Diendé   est créé en  2008 à  l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Ces membres sont très dynamiques. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Siré,  (debout au milieu du groupe, de bleu vêtue, et levant la main), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est gérante d’une boutique dans son quartier, avec a son actif plus de 20 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle va renouveler son stock de marchandises (riz, huile, sucre, thé etc.) afin de faire croître son chiffre d’affaire.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle désire donner à ses enfants un meilleur encadrement surtout au niveau scolaire.
texts.en:
The group Kambeng de Diendé was created in 2008 upon the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of 15 very dynamic women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Siré (standing second from the left and raising her hand) is the group leader. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a shop in her neighborhood, and she has over 20 years of experience in this activity.

With her loan, she will replenish her stock to bolster her sales. 

She will use her profits to better provide for her children, especially with respect to educational support.

loans.use: renouveler son stock de marchandises (riz, huile, sucre, thé etc.) afin de faire croître son chiffre d’affaire.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una emprendedora luchadora que ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo ha emprendido este negocio de la pulpería pero además a innovado nuevas líneas de productos como venta de mercadería en general y desinfectante para piso, lo cual ella nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su mercadería ofreciéndole a sus cliente variedad de producto. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, aceite, jabón, verduras, detergentes entre otros productos.
texts.en: Mercedes is a tenacious entrepreneur who has gotten ahead in life with many efforts. She has opened her grocery store, and on top of this she has also introduced new lines of activities such as selling general products and disinfectants for apartments. She told us that thanks to the previous loan she has bought more products, thus offering her customers a wider variety of items. She is currently requesting a loan to invest it in her activity by buying basic grains, oil, ham, vegetables and detergents among other products.

loans.use: basic grains, oil, ham, vegetables and detergents.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children, a son and a daughter. He describes himself to be God fearing and honest. 

Shaban operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. 

His business challenge is a shortage of charcoal. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. His business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal and own several similar charcoal retail stores within five years. 

Shaban's hope in the future is to buy a property to venture into a new business of providing rental housing services.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old married man who has operated a retail business for a period of 3 years now. He started with money he got from brick selling, a business he operated first. He faces the problems of price fluctuation and inadequate capital. He would like to build a permanent house, educate his children and diversify his business into other markets. Joseph needs the loan facility to buy cooking oil, sodas, beers and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sodas, beers and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a thirty-one-year-old man from Homabay County situated along the shores of Lake Victoria and is married to Edgar and they have two children aged two and five years.

Ben operates a motor vehicle spare parts shop in Homabay, a business he has been doing for the last three years, and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more stock of motor vehicle spare parts. He will use the profits to expand the business.

His dream is to use his income to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy stock of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have two children. She operates a cyber and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 12,500 from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD . She will use the loan to purchase a computer for her business. She was introduced to KADET LTD  by a KADET client.Her dream is to own rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a male adult of 42 years who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married and has 8 children. Deo runs a business of selling local brew and produce, which he has operated for 10 years now. He started by farming, and then he got money which he used to buy local brew, which is a steadily growing business. He faces a problem of high transportation costs and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. He would like to diversify into other businesses like cattle - raising animals. Deo intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno is 42 years old and married with 3 children living in Masindi, Uganda.

For the last 1 and a half years he has been operating a retail shop. He started the business with his salary savings earned as a civil servant. His dream is to educate children and build a permanent house. He is challenged by customers not paying on time, inadequate capital and high taxes. Bruno wants a loan to buy sodas, water and beer to resell.

loans.use: to buy beer, water and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hardworking mother of 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

She owns a beauty salon and has been doing this for 7 years. She faces hardships of price fluctuations and hopes to expand her business to new markets. Her family goal is to educate her children.

Florence needs a loan to buy cosmetics for use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for use in her salon.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael is 39 years old and married two children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the last nine years he has been dealing in phones and accessories. He started by hawking phones and after saving enough he rented an outlet. His dream is to educate his children and save for a wedding. 

He is challenged by customers not paying on time and the high cost of rent. Micheal wants a loan to buy phones for resale.

loans.use: to buy phones for resale.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo tiene 50 años de edad vive en la población del municipio de Chimoré provincia Carrasco de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el convive con la señora María junto a sus hijos, él tiene el oficio de albañil y también ayuda a su esposa  María en el puesto de venta del Kínder. Por desgracia como muchos Hugo cayo en el vicio de la bebida y fue despojándose de sus cosas e incluso haciendo a un lado a su familia, pero el tiempo y la responsabilidad de mantener su familia hizo que Hugo siente cabeza y se preocupe por el bienestar de los suyos, siendo que empezó a trabajar solo y fue ganando méritos con los conocidos de su esposa quienes lo requerían mucho por sus obras, en un tiempo alcanzo a dirigir equipos de construcción lo que fue su mayor distracción y así se olvidó poco a poco del del vicio en el que cayo, ahora tiene buena reputación en su trabajo y consigue contratos que le hacen alcanzar mayores ingresos y mejores situaciones para vivir junto a su familia. Ahora solicita un crédito con el que hará operar a su esposa de la vejiga ya que ella está un poco pasada de peso, quien tuvo molestias de la vejiga desde hace tiempo y por falta de dinero no pudo hacerse un chequeo y control médico, la señora aporta mucho en su familia ya que con la venta en el kínder mantiene apaliados muchos gastos y ahí es donde tiene los contactos para los contratos para Hugo. María esta consiente que fue un descuido por su parte, ahora ella y su esposo solicitan un crédito para mejorar su salud y hacerse intervenir en una operación no muy complicada y así poder seguir atendiendo su venta y mantener su familia sin perjuicios en sus quehaceres, de tal forma que  para Hugo lo primero es la salud y sin contar con un seguro de salud él se decidió a pagar la operación de su esposa y pagar en cuotas el crédito lo más antes posible.
Hugo anhela que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor que el que tuvo que peregrinar, sacar a sus hijos del bachillerato y luego encaminarlos en estudios superiores serán su próxima meta y trabajara muy duro y hará lo posible para que esta situación se haga realidad y vea sus hijos en lo futuro con sus vidas más plenas y mejoradas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 50 years old. He lives in the municipality of Chimoré, province of Carrasco, in the city of Cochabamba. He lives together with María Magdalena and their children. He works as a mason, and he also helps his wife María in her sales stand at a kindergarten. Unfortunately, like many men, Hugo fell into the vice of drinking, and he was neglecting his affairs and even putting his family aside. But time and the responsibility for maintaining his family led Hugo to come to his senses and concern himself more with the well-being of his loved ones. Thus he began working alone, without friends, and he built up a good reputation with his wife's acquaintances, who needed him often for their projects. Over time he advanced to managing construction teams, which was his best distraction, and thus he forgot little by little the problem that lede him to neglect his own situation and that of his family. Now he has a good reputation in his work, and he obtains contracts that give him a better income and let him provide better living conditions for his family. Now he is requesting a loan which he will use to pay for a bladder operation for his wife, since she is a bit overweight and she has been having trouble with her bladder for some time, but the lack of money prevented her from getting medical checkups. She contributes greatly to the family, since with the sales stand at the kindergarten she covers a lot of expenses, and this is also where she finds the contacts for Hugo's work contracts. María realizes that this was negligence on her part, but now she and her husband are requesting a loan to improve her health; she will undergo an operation that is not very complicated, and then she will be able to continue operating her sales stand and maintaining her family without hindrances to her daily activities. For Hugo, health comes first, and without having health insurance, he decided to pay for his wife's operation and pay off the loan in installments as quickly as possible. 

Hugo's desire is that his children will have a future that is better than the path he had to travel. He wants to help them finish an advanced high school degree, and his next goal will be to set them on their path with higher education. He will work very hard and do everything possible to make this a reality, so he can see his children in the future with lives that are full and improved.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's bladder operation.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – фермер-сельскохозяйственник. Уже 8 лет он вместе с семьей занимается выращиванием ранних овощей для оптовой продажи в разных областях Украины. На 1 гектаре земли Сергей выращивает 3 тонны раннего редиса, 20 000 кустов перца, 20 000 голов капусты, 10 000 кустов помидор, 2 000 кустов огурцов, а также 6 000 кустов кабачков. За все годы работы Сергей вложил в свое дело около 100 000 гривен. Однако его чистая прибыль немногим больше 5 000 гривен. 

Кредит от КИВА позволит Сергею приобрести семена для посева на 6 000 гривен, необходимые удобрения на  сумму 4 000 гривен, а также построить дополнительную теплицу на 6 000 гривен и купить полиэтиленовую пленку на 4 000 гривен. В селе, где Сергей живет вместе с семьей очень мало вариантов для трудоустройства. Поэтому занятие сельским хозяйством предоставляет этой семье такие необходимые средства для существования. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Sergei is a farmer-agriculturalist.  For eight years already, he and his family have been growing early vegetables for wholesale in various provinces across Ukraine.  On 1 hectare of land, Sergei raises 3 tons of early radish, 20,000 pepper bushes, 20,000 head of cabbage, 10,000 tomato bushes, 2,000 cucumber plants, and 6,000 squash plants.  Over all the years of his work, Sergei has invested about 100,000 hryven (UAH) in his farm.  However, his net profit has been a little more than 5,000 hryven.

The loan he gets through Kiva will make it possible for Sergei to buy seed in the amount of 6,000 hryven, the necessary fertilizers in the amount of 4,000 hryven, to build an additional greenhouse for 6,000 hryven, and to buy polyethylene film for 4,000.  There are very few alternatives for employment in the village where Sergei and his family live.  And so, farming is what gives this family the wherewithal to live.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, to build an additional greenhouse, and to buy  polyethylene film

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 34 years old, married with one child. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since she joined  Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes, beans, bananas and maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, beans, bananas, tomatoes and maize to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a pub to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Charity has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy five crates of beer.

loans.use: To buy five crates of beer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old.  She is married and has three children, aged 31, 26 and 21. She started farming 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Mary has requested for a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase animal feeds for her cows. The profit she makes will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to expand her business and educate her last born child. This is her second loan.

loans.use: buy animal feed

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 5 years. He describes himself as a focused and ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells furniture such as beds, sofa sets, dressing tables, dinning table, wall units, ward robes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located at a viable area and his primary customers are walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge to be sometimes the low purchasing power from the customers. 

Sebastian will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy timber to make more furniture to sell. He hopes that in the future, he can diversify his business.

loans.use: buy timber to make furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
I am the second born in a family of three sisters and we all live with our mother who has raised us single-handedly. I chose Strathmore University because it is one of the best in the country and it offers quality education. It has produced prominent persons of high integrity.

I am applying for a loan since my mother is unable to raise part of my school fees due to her low income. If I can obtain a loan, I am hopeful of starting my first year in March, 2012. 

I want to pursue a career in commerce for a bright future for me and my family. I hope to get the best out of it and I am particularly interested in accounting and audit. My vision is to deliver quality services and contribute to wealth creation in Kenya after my graduation.

At the moment, I am working as a volunteer for St. John Ambulance, training my local community in first aid skills.

loans.use: to pay school fees for a four year undergraduate degree in commerce.

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.en: Josiane is a mother of two children whose ages are between 2 and 6. The oldest attends school and another one is still young.  Her husband works as a farmer.  Josiane is a group leader for the group called Amahoro meaning "Peace" in English.  The group members sell different products and all are very happy with the new loan they wish to get.  Josiane as a group leader sells foodstuff and she has been in this business for the past three years. She has decided to request the loan to buy more foodstuffs for sell.  With the profits from the business, she plans to build her commercial house instead of renting. In the future, she plans to expand her business and gain better profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Yudy Patricia

texts.es:
Yudy proviene de una familia que siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades de la agricultura y producción agropecuaria, es por esto que gracias a sus padres adquirió el conocimiento del cuidado de ganado y vacas lecheras. Yudy se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario. Debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para sostener los gastos de su hogar, Yudy inició su negocio comprando una vaca lechera la cual le genera diariamente ingresos por la venta de la leche que produce, y gracias a esto puede contribuir económicamente con los ingresos del hogar. Yudy, actualmente tiene la posibilidad de que su cliente le compre más leche de la que puede producir con una sola vaca, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su capacidad de producción de leche y poder generar mayores ingresos.

Yudy espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y pueda de esta manera ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Además, espera que sus hijos puedan acceder a una mejor educación y en un futuro puedan tener una estabilidad económica. Yudy tiene el sueño de que su negocio les brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de su casa propia y así poder ofrecerles a su esposo y sus 2 hijos mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
